_header: At the reverence of Saint Margaret / My purpose is
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 223; for a version in short couplets see 1192.
Subjects: saints’ lives; Margaret, saint, life of; prologues; envoys
_description: John Lydgate, Life of St Margaret — seventy-seven stanzas rhyme royal including an eleven-stanza prologue and three-stanza Envoy

Bod686.First Lines:
At the reuerence of seint margareteMy purpos is hir lyf to
                    compile…
Bod686.Last Lines:
…Til atte last in vertu complet godeffor cristes sake she
                    shedde hir herte blode
Bod686.Attributed Title:
Here begynneth þe prologe of þe holy seynt seyn Margarete
                    compendiously compiled in balade by lydgate Dan Iohn Monke of Bury. Anno viii
                    henr viti (f. 193v); Here endeth þe prologe of Seynt
                    Margarete And nexte folowyng begynneth hir storye (194v); Here endeth
                    þe life of seynte Margarete And begynneth þe lyfe of the glorious
                    martir seint George (f. 200)
